question: Chandella Kings are related to which of the following temples?
explanation: The Chandelas of Jejakabhukti were a royal dynasty in Central India. They ruled much of the Bundelkhand region between the 9th and the 13th centuries.The most famous example of their cultural achievements are the Hindu and Jain temples at Khajuraho. Other important Chandela strongholds were Jayapura-Durga (modern Ajaigarh), Kalanjara (modern Kalinjar) and Mahotsava-Nagara (modern Mahoba).
